bill_title: require the offering and rejecting of certain health benefits in certain health benefit plans.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the offering and rejecting of certain health benefits in certain health benefit plans. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 58-17 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Every health insurer issuing a health benefit plan shall, in addition to the benefits required by this title, also offer any insured the option to purchase the following supplemental health benefits: (1) In addition to the biologically based mental illnesses pursuant to § 58-17-98, coverage for all other or selected other mental illnesses; (2) Coverage for selected dental procedures; (3) Coverage for vision care; (4) Extra coverage for specified diseases; (5) Hospital indemnity; (6) Surgical indemnity; (7) Accident coverage; and (8) Disability coverage. Section 2. That chapter 58-17 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Every health insurer issuing a health benefit plan shall allow the prospective insured to reject any of the standard benefits offered in the health benefit plan and obtain the health benefit plan at a reduced rate based upon the actuarial difference in benefit plan design. This section does not apply to any coverage provided pursuant to the Women's Health and Cancer Rights Act of 1998 or to § 58-17-88. Section 3. That chapter 58-18 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Every health insurer issuing a health benefit plan shall, in addition to the benefits required by this title, also offer any insured the option to purchase the following supplemental health benefits: (1) In addition to the biologically based mental illnesses pursuant to § 58-18-80, coverage for all other or selected other mental illnesses; (2) Coverage for selected dental procedures; (3) Coverage for vision care; (4) Extra coverage for specified diseases; (5) Hospital indemnity; (6) Surgical indemnity; (7) Accident coverage; and (8) Disability coverage. Section 4. That chapter 58-18 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Every health insurer issuing a health benefit plan shall allow the prospective insured to reject any of the standard benefits offered in the health benefit plan and obtain the health benefit plan at a reduced rate based upon the actuarial difference in benefit plan design. This section does not apply to any coverage provided pursuant to the Women's Health and Cancer Rights Act of 1998, to § 58-18-76, to maternity benefits for employers with fifteen or more employees, or to the Mental Health Parity Act of 1996.
